alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 8:42PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hunterdon, eastern Berks, southeastern Lehigh, north central Montgomery, northwestern Bucks and south central Northampton Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 842 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Geryville, or 12 miles south of Allentown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Quakertown, Perkasie, Byram, Bedminster, Hellertown, Tinicum, East Greenville, Dublin, Ferndale, Riegelsville, Steuben, Green Lane, Pleasant Valley, Revere, Zionsville and Lehigh University. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 35 and 54. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 57 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
